name: Mango Tree
origin: Myanmar, Bangladesh, and northeastern India
properties: Various parts of plant are used as a dentrifrice, antiseptic, astringent, diaphoretic, stomachic, vermifuge, tonic, laxative and diuretic and to treat diarrhea, dysentery, anaemia, asthma, bronchitis, cough, hypertension, insomnia, rheumatism, toothache, leucorrhoea, haemorrhage and piles.

name: Golden Trumpet
origin: native to Brazil.
properties: treat liver tumors, jaundice, splenomegaly, and malaria

name: Neem
origin: assam and burma
properties: treatment of inflammation, infections, fever, skin diseases and dental disorders

name: Child life tree
origin: Southeast Asia
properties: treating of illness, phlegm, skin ailment, aridity and are also helpful in curing rheumatism

name: Catpus
origin: native through most of the length of North and South America, from British Columbia and Alberta southward
properties: reduce inflammation in the body,treating diabetes, high cholesterol, obesity and hangovers.

name: Royal palm
origin: native to Mexico, parts of Central America and the Caribbean, and southern Florida.
properties: used for thatch, construction timber, and in some forms of so-called traditional medicine

name: Lebbreck tree
origin: tropical Africa, Asia and Northern Australia
properties: prevention of scabies, lung ailments, piles, bronchitis, abdominal tumors, cough and eye disorder

name: Pala Indigo Plant
origin: India, southeast Asia and Australia
properties: bark is useful in treatment of diarrhoea, piles, ringworm and other skin diseases

name: Narra/Angsana
origin: Native to southeastern Asia, northern Australasia, and the western Pacific Ocean islands( in Cambodia, southernmost China, East Timor, Indonesia, Malaysia, Papua New Guinea, the Philippines, the Ryukyu Islands, the Solomon Islands, Thailand, and Vietnam.)
properties: primarily used for cabinetwork

name: beech wood
origin: Asia, from Pakistan to Sri Lanka, Myanmar, Thailand, Vietnam and southern China
properties: astringent, bitter, digestive, cardiotonic, diuretic, laxative and pulmonary and nervine tonic

name: Indian beech tree
origin: native to eastern and tropical Asia, Australia, and Pacific islands.
properties: used for landscaping as a windbreak or for shade due to the large canopy and showy, fragrant flowers.

name: arjun tree
origin: native to India but was introduced into the African continent decades ago
properties: used for anginal pain, hypertension, congestive heart failure, and dyslipidemia

name: asoka tree
origin: central areas of the Deccan plateau, as well as the middle section of the Western Ghats in the western coastal zone of the Indian subcontinent.
properties: treatment of uterine, genital, and other reproductive disorders in women, fever, pain, and inflammation.

name: black mundar
origin: southern and southeast Asia in India, Nepal, Bangladesh, Myanmar, Thailand, Laos, Cambodia, and Vietnam
properties: The wood is used for furniture, cabinetwork, joinery, paneling, specialty items, boat-building, railroad cross-ties (treated), decorative veneers and for musical instruments

name: rubber fig
origin: Himalayas to Malaysia, Sumatra and Java
properties: very helpful with a host of stomach problems such as nausea, general pain or digestive problems.

name: African Tulip Tree
origin: indigenous to Africa with a native range that extends along the west coast from Guinea to Angola, and inland across the tropical rainforest region to southern Sudan and Uganda
properties: epilepsy and convulsion control, against kidney disease, urethritis, and as antidote against animal poisons

name: Spinous Kino Tree
origin: base of the Himalayas from Kashmir to Mishmi, southward to Ceylon
properties: Root and bark are used as an astringent and used as a liniment with gingelly oil in rheumatic problems

name: Devil tree
origin: native to southern China, tropical Asia (mainly the Indian subcontinent and Southeast Asia）and Australasia
properties: treatment of malaria, jaundice, gastrointestinal troubles, cancer and in many other ailments.

name: Flame of the forest
origin: humid lowland forested areas of India and Sri Lanka.
properties: anti-diarrheal, anthelmintic, anti-diabetic, anti-stress, hepatoprotective, antifungal, astringent, aphrodisiac, laxative, anti-inflammatory and antioxidant qualities

name: nux vomica
origin: native to India and to southeast Asia
properties: erectile dysfunction (ED), swelling of the stomach, constipation, anxiety, migraine, and many other conditions

name: indian tulip tree
origin: Asian tropics or from the coasts of the Pacific and Indian Oceans
properties: treatment of indigestion, dysentery, rheumatism, coughs and fevers

name: Indian Willow
origin: native to southern India and Sri Lanka
properties: treatment of fever, helminthiasis, diabetes and various cardiac problems.

name: Three leaved chaste tree
origin: tropical East Africa as far east as French Polynesia.
properties: treat menstrual cycle problems and pain, premenstrual syndrome, and menopause.

name: Java Plum
origin: native to the Indian subcontinent, adjoining regions of Southeast Asia, including Myanmar, Sri Lanka, and the Andaman Islands.
properties: Jamun fruit works miraculously in diabetes

name: Chebulic myrobalan
origin: n the Sub Himalayan tracks from Ravi eastwards to West Bengal and Assam, ascending upto the altitude of 1 500 m in the Himalayas.
properties: increase appetite, digestive aid, liver stimulant, stomachic, gastrointestinal prokinetic agent, and mild laxative

name: jackfruit Tree
origin: region between the Western Ghats of southern India, all of Bangladesh, Sri Lanka and the rainforests of the Philippines, Indonesia, and Malaysia.
properties: treatment of asthma, prevent ringworm infection, and heal cracking of the feet.

name: Bottle brush
origin: endemic to Australia
properties: treatment of gastro-enteritis, diarrhea and skin infections

name: Indian almond
origin: native to Asia, Australia, the Pacific, Madagascar and Seychelles
properties: Juice of young leaves are employed in preparation of ointment for leprosy, scabies and also used internally for colic and headache

name: Fern tree
origin: found in east Africa, Madagascar, India and Sri Lanka
properties: anti-diabetic, anti-fungal, anti-bacterial, anti-inflammatory, antioxidant and mollusicicidal activities.

name: Indian cork tree
origin: native to South Asia and South East Asia
properties: antipyretic, sinusitis, cholagogue and tonic in folklore medicine

name: Cuban pink trumpet tree
origin: native to the Caribbean
properties: treatment of a plethora of ailments. The bark of the tree has the most medicinal properties

name: Bitter albizia
origin: southern and Eastern Africa, from South Africa to Sudan and Ethiopia.
properties: The leaves and flowers are used for treatment of boils and ulcers. The leaf is also used for treatment of erysipelas. Paste of leaf and rootbark is used to cure both skin diseases and poisonous bites.

name: Indian gooseberry
origin: Native to China, Taiwan, the Indian Sub-continent and south-eastern Asia
properties: treatment of Swelling of the pancreas, Indigestion,Eye problems, Joint pain, Diarrhea,Bloody diarrhea (dysentery), Obesity,Diabetes.

name: Red sandalwood
origin: endemic to India and can only be found in the southern parts of the Eastern Ghats.
properties: treatment of cancer, wounds, digestive tract problems, fluid retention

name: Gum Arabic
origin: derived from hardened acacia tree sap, harvested in the Sahel region of Africa
properties: treatment of high cholesterol, diabetes, irritable bowel syndrome (IBS), and other conditions

name: yellow trumpet
origin: Sierra Leone to Sudan to as far south as Angola and Zimbabwe.
properties: treat many illnesses including eye infections and cataract.

name: gold apple
origin: native across the Indian subcontinent and Southeast Asia, and is cultivated throughout Sri Lanka, Tamilnadu.
properties: to treat tuberculosis, leaf juice with honey can prove useful for treating fever and to cure inflammation

name: cannon ball tree
origin: native to northeastern South America
properties: to treat hypertension, tumors, colds, stomachaches, toothaches, and skin conditions

name: Veppu
origin: native to Indomalaya and Australasia.
properties: traditional medicine for the treatment of several ailments including fever due to malaria.

name: Pink  trumpet tree
origin: northern South America
properties: treating fever, malaria, bacterial and fungal infections, and skin disease

name: Indian butter tree
origin: central, southern, north Indian plains and forests, Nepal, Myanmar and Sri Lanka
properties: mixed with ghee and used as a dressing to relieve burns and skin allergies.

name: Bismarck palm
origin: in the palm family endemic to western and northern Madagascar where they grow in open grassland
properties: The palm tree is mostly used for landscaping purposes. The tree works as a good focal point in a yard or landscape
